metadata.title: CVE-2019-16249 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenCV 4.1.1 has an out-of-bounds read in hal_baseline::v_load incore/hal/intrin_sse.hpp when called from computeSSDMeanNorm inmodules/video/src/dis_flow.cpp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16249` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-contrib406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-core406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-dnn406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-features2d406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-flann406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-highgui406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-imgcodecs406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-imgproc406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-java - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-ml406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-objdetect406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-photo406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-shape406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-stitching406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-superres406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-video406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-videoio406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-videostab406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv-viz406t64 - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
libopencv406-jni - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
opencv-data - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
python3-opencv - 4.6.0+dfsg-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opencv package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.6.0+dfsg-4').
